structural_analysis.context_justification: The text begins with the header 'द्वितीयः प्रश्नः' (Second Question), establishing the first-level coordinate as 2. The first verse (mantra) is numbered '१', establishing the second-level coordinate as 1. Thus, the start ID is 2.1.
structural_analysis.filename_justification: Combines the grantha ID ('prashna-upanishad'), a slug of the commentator ('rangaramanuja-muni'), and the zero-padded, hyphenated start ID ('02-01') for a unique, sortable filename.

proposed_strategy.name: Validated Group by Character Count
proposed_strategy.description: This strategy combines consecutive Prashnas, strictly ensuring no chunk exceeds the safety character limit. The plan is regenerated internally if any proposed chunk is too large.

execution_plan.description: The entirety of the second Prashna (द्वितीयः प्रश्नः).

parsing_instructions.justification: The Upanishad is primarily divided into Prashnas (Questions), which are the main semantic and structural sections.
parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: For the Mantras within a Prashna, extract the Devanagari numeral enclosed by '।।' symbols at the end of the bolded verse line (e.g., '।। १ ।।').

start_pattern.description: A new Prashna begins with a bolded heading indicating its Sanskrit ordinal number followed by the word 'प्रश्नः'.

end_pattern.description: The end of a Prashna's commentary is marked by a concluding line identifying the section.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: The optional topic heading in square brackets (e.g., '[प्राणप्रशंसा]') should be captured and associated with the following Prashna as a subtitle.
